solution_line_template: His annual salary for the first year of working is {monthly_salary} x {months_per_year}= $<<{monthly_salary}*{months_per_year}={annual_salary_first_year}>>{annual_salary_first_year}.
So, he received ${monthly_salary} + ${monthly_increase}= $<<{monthly_salary}+{monthly_increase}={new_monthly_salary}>>{new_monthly_salary} monthly on the second and third year of working.
Kirt's annual salary in the second and third year was ${new_monthly_salary} x {months_per_year} = ${annual_salary_subsequent_years}.

Thus, his total earning after 3 years is ${annual_salary_first_year} + ${annual_salary_subsequent_years} + ${annual_salary_subsequent_years} = $<<{annual_salary_first_year}+{annual_salary_subsequent_years}+{annual_salary_subsequent_years}={total_earnings}>>{total_earnings}.
